property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A U.S. service member speaking with Pakistani counterparts

note.text: Pakistanis value getting to know people before beginning to work with them. For this reason, itâ€™s important to spend time building rapport.

Building relationships with your counterparts is a slow process. Meetings will usually begin with small talk. In fact, your first few meetings may consist entirely of casual small talk. Don't rush to bring up business as this may damage your relationship. Be patient and always wait for your counterpart to bring up business.
